vrPpIpxPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpxPRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpxP components.

vrPpIpxPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpxPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpxPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpxP component.

vrPpIpxPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpxPRowStatus
vrPpIpxPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpxP components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpxPComponentName.name: vrPpIpxPComponentName
vrPpIpxPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpxPStorageType.name: vrPpIpxPStorageType
vrPpIpxPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpxP tables.

vrPpIpxPIndex.name: vrPpIpxPIndex
vrPpIpxPIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpxP tables.

vrPpIpxPAdminControlTable.name: vrPpIpxPAdminControlTable
vrPpIpxPAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrPpIpxPSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrPpIpxPSnmpAdminStatus
vrPpIpxPSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpxPProvTable.name: vrPpIpxPProvTable
vrPpIpxPProvTable.description: The Provisionable group for the IpxPort component.

vrPpIpxPNetworkNumberProv.name: vrPpIpxPNetworkNumberProv
vrPpIpxPNetworkNumberProv.description: The Ipx network number of the network directly connected to this port.

vrPpIpxPDefaultType.name: vrPpIpxPDefaultType
vrPpIpxPDefaultType.description: This attribute indicates which protocol is to run on a protocol port. In the case of a lan media it is to be set to broadcast. In the case of WAN media the following choices are to be exercised: For running Pre-IPXWAN RIP set value to other. For running numbered RIP set value to wanRip. For running un-numbered RIP set value to unnumberedRip. Setting this value to ppp will signify unnumbered Rip running on a ppp port.

vrPpIpxPBroadcastInhibit.name: vrPpIpxPBroadcastInhibit
vrPpIpxPBroadcastInhibit.description: If this attribute is set, all outgoing periodic and triggered updates for RIP and SAP will be inhibited for the port. However the port will still accept incoming RIP and SAP packets on the port. This may be useful for ports with only a bank of servers on its network in order to limit the routing traffic, assuming that servers don't require routing information or other server information.

vrPpIpxPSresProvTable.name: vrPpIpxPSresProvTable
vrPpIpxPSresProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for SourceRouteEndStation support.

vrPpIpxPSourceRouteEndStationSupport.name: vrPpIpxPSourceRouteEndStationSupport
vrPpIpxPSourceRouteEndStationSupport.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable support for SourceRouteEndStation (Sres). If set to enable, Sres will be supported on this protocol on this ProtocolPort (Pp). If set to disable, it will not be supported. An Sres component must be provisioned under the VirtualRouter if this attribute is set to enable. If this attribute is set to enable and this Pp has its linkToMedia attribute set, it must be linked to a LanApplication (La) that has its Framer interfaceName linked to a Fddi or TokenRing component.

vrPpIpxPStateTable.name: vrPpIpxPStateTable
vrPpIpxPStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrPpIpxPAdminState.name: vrPpIpxPAdminState
vrPpIpxPAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrPpIpxPOperationalState.name: vrPpIpxPOperationalState
vrPpIpxPOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrPpIpxPUsageState.name: vrPpIpxPUsageState
vrPpIpxPUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrPpIpxPOperStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPOperStatusTable
vrPpIpxPOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrPpIpxPSnmpOperStatus.name: vrPpIpxPSnmpOperStatus
vrPpIpxPSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpxPType.name: vrPpIpxPType
vrPpIpxPType.description: The type of the circuit. This would differ from the provisioned type when a different routing protocol is negotiated with the peer.

vrPpIpxPEncapsulation.name: vrPpIpxPEncapsulation
vrPpIpxPEncapsulation.description: Packet encapsulation type that the router has determined to use on the port. There are seven encapsulation types used to identify IPX datagram as listed below. 1. link: IPX encapsulation type for PPP, ATM MPE, and X25DTE media types. 2. ethernet: IPX encapsulation type for Ethernet and FrDte media types. 3. novell: IPX encapsulation type for Ethernet and FrDte media types. 4. sap: IPX encapsulation type for FDDI, Token Ring, Ethernet and FrDte media types. 5. snap: IPX encapsulation type for FDDI, Token Ring, Ethernet, and FrDte media types. 6. vns: IPX encapsulation type for VNS media type. 7. tunnel: IPX encapsulation type for Tunnel media type.

vrPpIpxPNetworkNumber.name: vrPpIpxPNetworkNumber
vrPpIpxPNetworkNumber.description: The Ipx network number from the provisioned networkNumberProv value.

vrPpIpxPNode.name: vrPpIpxPNode
vrPpIpxPNode.description: The Ipx node address of this IpxPort.

vrPpIpxPStateChanges.name: vrPpIpxPStateChanges
vrPpIpxPStateChanges.description: Number of times the port has changed state. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPInReceives.name: vrPpIpxPInReceives
vrPpIpxPInReceives.description: Total number of packets received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPForwarded.name: vrPpIpxPForwarded
vrPpIpxPForwarded.description: Number of packets forwarded. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpxPRipP components.

vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpxPRipP component.

vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatus
vrPpIpxPRipPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpxPRipP components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrPpIpxPRipPComponentName.name: vrPpIpxPRipPComponentName
vrPpIpxPRipPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpxPRipPStorageType.name: vrPpIpxPRipPStorageType
vrPpIpxPRipPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpxPRipP tables.

vrPpIpxPRipPIndex.name: vrPpIpxPRipPIndex
vrPpIpxPRipPIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpxPRipP tables.

vrPpIpxPRipPStatsTable.name: vrPpIpxPRipPStatsTable
vrPpIpxPRipPStatsTable.description: RIP specific statistics for this IpxPort.

vrPpIpxPRipPInPackets.name: vrPpIpxPRipPInPackets
vrPpIpxPRipPInPackets.description: The number of RIP packets received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPInRequests.name: vrPpIpxPRipPInRequests
vrPpIpxPRipPInRequests.description: The number of RIP request packets received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPInResponses.name: vrPpIpxPRipPInResponses
vrPpIpxPRipPInResponses.description: The number of RIP response packets received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPOutPackets.name: vrPpIpxPRipPOutPackets
vrPpIpxPRipPOutPackets.description: The number of RIP packets sent out on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPOutRequests.name: vrPpIpxPRipPOutRequests
vrPpIpxPRipPOutRequests.description: The number of RIP request packets sent out on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPOutResponses.name: vrPpIpxPRipPOutResponses
vrPpIpxPRipPOutResponses.description: The number of RIP response packets sent out on this IpxPort. This includes RIP periodic update packets. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPRipPIncorrectPackets.name: vrPpIpxPRipPIncorrectPackets
vrPpIpxPRipPIncorrectPackets.description: Number of times that an incorrectly formatted RIP packet was received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpxPSapP components.

vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpxPSapP component.

vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatus
vrPpIpxPSapPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpxPSapP components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrPpIpxPSapPComponentName.name: vrPpIpxPSapPComponentName
vrPpIpxPSapPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpxPSapPStorageType.name: vrPpIpxPSapPStorageType
vrPpIpxPSapPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpxPSapP tables.

vrPpIpxPSapPIndex.name: vrPpIpxPSapPIndex
vrPpIpxPSapPIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpxPSapP tables.

vrPpIpxPSapPStatsTable.name: vrPpIpxPSapPStatsTable
vrPpIpxPSapPStatsTable.description: SAP specific statistics for this IpxPort.

vrPpIpxPSapPInPackets.name: vrPpIpxPSapPInPackets
vrPpIpxPSapPInPackets.description: The total number of SAP packets received on this IpxPort. Includes SAP requests and responses. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPInRequests.name: vrPpIpxPSapPInRequests
vrPpIpxPSapPInRequests.description: The number of SAP Request packets received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPInResponses.name: vrPpIpxPSapPInResponses
vrPpIpxPSapPInResponses.description: The number of SAP response packets received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPOutPackets.name: vrPpIpxPSapPOutPackets
vrPpIpxPSapPOutPackets.description: The total number of SAP packets sent out this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPOutRequests.name: vrPpIpxPSapPOutRequests
vrPpIpxPSapPOutRequests.description: The number of SAP request packets sent out on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPOutResponses.name: vrPpIpxPSapPOutResponses
vrPpIpxPSapPOutResponses.description: The number of SAP response packets sent out this IpxPort. This includes periodic SAP update packets. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPSapPIncorrectPackets.name: vrPpIpxPSapPIncorrectPackets
vrPpIpxPSapPIncorrectPackets.description: Number of times an incorrectly formatted SAP packet was received on this IpxPort. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpxPIWP components.

vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpxPIWP component.

vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatus
vrPpIpxPIWPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpxPIWP components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrPpIpxPIWPComponentName.name: vrPpIpxPIWPComponentName
vrPpIpxPIWPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpxPIWPStorageType.name: vrPpIpxPIWPStorageType
vrPpIpxPIWPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpxPIWP tables.

vrPpIpxPIWPRemoteStationIdentifierIndex.name: vrPpIpxPIWPRemoteStationIdentifierIndex
vrPpIpxPIWPRemoteStationIdentifierIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpxPIWP tables.

vrPpIpxPIWPOperTable.name: vrPpIpxPIWPOperTable
vrPpIpxPIWPOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group contains operational attributes that are specific for the IPXWAN protocol.

vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourRouterName.name: vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourRouterName
vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourRouterName.description: The name of the neighboring router on a WAN circuit.

vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourInternalNetworkNumbe.name: vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourInternalNetworkNumber
vrPpIpxPIWPNeighbourInternalNetworkNumbe.description: The internal network number of the neighboring router on a WAN circuit.

vrPpIpxPIWPInitFails.name: vrPpIpxPIWPInitFails
vrPpIpxPIWPInitFails.description: The number of times initialization has failed on this circuit. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpxPNetSentryP components.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpxPNetSentryP component.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatus
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpxPNetSentryP components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPComponentName.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPComponentName
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPStorageType.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPStorageType
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpxPNetSentryP tables.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPIndex.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPIndex
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpxPNetSentryP tables.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPProvTable.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPProvTable
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPProvTable.description: This group contains the NetSentry attributes that specify the names of the NetSentry filters which will be applied to IPX packets as incoming and outgoing filters.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPInComingFilter.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPInComingFilter
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPInComingFilter.description: This attribute specifies the name of the NetSentry filter applied to incoming IPX packets on this port.

vrPpIpxPNetSentryPOutGoingFilter.name: vrPpIpxPNetSentryPOutGoingFilter
vrPpIpxPNetSentryPOutGoingFilter.description: The name of the filter applied to outgoing IPX packets on this port.

vrIpxRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxRowStatusTable
vrIpxRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpx components.

vrIpxRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxRowStatusEntry
vrIpxRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpx component.

vrIpxRowStatus.name: vrIpxRowStatus
vrIpxRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpx components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxComponentName.name: vrIpxComponentName
vrIpxComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxStorageType.name: vrIpxStorageType
vrIpxStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpx tables.

vrIpxIndex.name: vrIpxIndex
vrIpxIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpx tables.

vrIpxAdminControlTable.name: vrIpxAdminControlTable
vrIpxAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrIpxSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrIpxSnmpAdminStatus
vrIpxSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpxNetworkNumber.name: vrIpxNetworkNumber
vrIpxNetworkNumber.description: This attribute indicates the internal network number portion of the IPX address. This network number must be unique within the internetwork and is necessary to determine master/slave relationships during IPXWAN negotiations.

vrIpxMaxPathSplits.name: vrIpxMaxPathSplits
vrIpxMaxPathSplits.description: This attribute indicates the maximum number of paths with equal routing metric value which this instance of IPX may split between when forwarding packets.

vrIpxMaxHops.name: vrIpxMaxHops
vrIpxMaxHops.description: This attribute indicates the maximum number of hops a packet may take.

vrIpxRipUpdateInterval.name: vrIpxRipUpdateInterval
vrIpxRipUpdateInterval.description: The RIP periodic update interval, in seconds.

vrIpxSapUpdateInterval.name: vrIpxSapUpdateInterval
vrIpxSapUpdateInterval.description: The SAP periodic update interval, in seconds.

vrIpxControlDelay.name: vrIpxControlDelay
vrIpxControlDelay.description: The delay, in microsecs, between receiving a request from a client and sending a response. This router is significantly faster than some Ipx clients. If a problem is being experienced between a router and an Ipx client, it might be resolved by changing the controlDelay.

vrIpxUpdateDelay.name: vrIpxUpdateDelay
vrIpxUpdateDelay.description: The delay, in milliseconds, between sending consecutive (RIP and/or SAP) packets. 55 milliseconds is the minimum specified in the Ipx Router Specification.

vrIpxRipAgeMultiplier.name: vrIpxRipAgeMultiplier
vrIpxRipAgeMultiplier.description: After this many Rip Update intervals unrefreshed Rip information is considered expired.

vrIpxSapAgeMultiplier.name: vrIpxSapAgeMultiplier
vrIpxSapAgeMultiplier.description: After this many SAP Update intervals unrefreshed SAP information is considered expired.

vrIpxDamping.name: vrIpxDamping
vrIpxDamping.description: This attribute specifies whether damping is applied. Damping refers to the damping of incoming RIP and SAP requests. It handles cases where a rogue client or server is making an extraodinary number of requests. With damping set to disabled, the switch will reply to all requests with no check for rogue nodes.With damping set to enabled, the switch will not reply to a request if the same node made more than the allowable number of requests within 10 seconds. The maximum number of requests to damp at is specified by the following provisionable attributes: ripMaxDampedGeneralRequest, ripMaxDampedSpecificRequests, sapMaxDampedGeneralRequests, sapMaxDampedSpecificRequests.

vrIpxRipMaxDampedGeneralRequests.name: vrIpxRipMaxDampedGeneralRequests
vrIpxRipMaxDampedGeneralRequests.description: This attribute is only used when the attribute damping is enabled. It is used to limit the average rate at which the switch responds to general RIP requests. If more than this number are received within a ten second interval, the first ripMaxDampedGeneralRequests are responded to and the remainder are ignored.

vrIpxRipMaxDampedSpecificRequests.name: vrIpxRipMaxDampedSpecificRequests
vrIpxRipMaxDampedSpecificRequests.description: This attribute is only used when the attribute damping is enabled. It is used to limit the average rate at which the switch responds to specific RIP requests. If more than this number are received within a ten second interval, the first ripMaxDampedSpecificRequests are responded to and the remainder are ignored.

vrIpxSapMaxDampedGeneralRequests.name: vrIpxSapMaxDampedGeneralRequests
vrIpxSapMaxDampedGeneralRequests.description: This attribute is only used when the attribute damping is enabled. It is used to limit the average rate at which the switch responds to general SAP requests. If more than this number are received within a ten second interval, the first sapMaxDampedGeneralRequests are responded to and the remainder are ignored.

vrIpxSapMaxDampedSpecificRequests.name: vrIpxSapMaxDampedSpecificRequests
vrIpxSapMaxDampedSpecificRequests.description: This attribute is only used when the attribute damping is enabled. It is used to limit the average rate at which the switch responds to specific SAP requests. If more than this number are received within a ten second interval, the first sapMaxDampedSpecificRequests are responded to and the remainder are ignored.

vrIpxInitialGeneralRequests.name: vrIpxInitialGeneralRequests
vrIpxInitialGeneralRequests.description: This attribute specifies whether the RIP and SAP general requests are sent out a port when the port first comes up. If this attribute is enabled the initial requests will be made; whereas if the attribute is disabled the initial requests will not be made. This attribute may be disabled in order to avoid the traffic resulting within the network from these initial requests and the ensuing responses. With the initial request disabled, the switch will learn about other network segments off of the IPX ports via the periodic broadcasts which are received on those port.

vrIpxHoldDownInterval.name: vrIpxHoldDownInterval
vrIpxHoldDownInterval.description: This attribute specifies an interval, after a network is removed from the route table, during which other incoming route updates for the same network will be ignored. The use of this interval prevents the slow convergence which results when switches that receive late network down broadcasts advertise false routes.

vrIpxStateTable.name: vrIpxStateTable
vrIpxStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpxAdminState.name: vrIpxAdminState
vrIpxAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpxOperationalState.name: vrIpxOperationalState
vrIpxOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpxUsageState.name: vrIpxUsageState
vrIpxUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpxOperStatusTable.name: vrIpxOperStatusTable
vrIpxOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrIpxSnmpOperStatus.name: vrIpxSnmpOperStatus
vrIpxSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpxOperTable.name: vrIpxOperTable
vrIpxOperTable.description: This group contains IPX related operational attributes.

vrIpxProtocolPortCount.name: vrIpxProtocolPortCount
vrIpxProtocolPortCount.description: The number of portsknown to this instance of Ipx.

vrIpxDestinationCount.name: vrIpxDestinationCount
vrIpxDestinationCount.description: The number of currently reachable destinations known to Ipx.

vrIpxServicesCount.name: vrIpxServicesCount
vrIpxServicesCount.description: The number of Services known to Ipx.

vrIpxStatsTable.name: vrIpxStatsTable
vrIpxStatsTable.description: This group contains IPX related statistics on the CP.

vrIpxInReceives.name: vrIpxInReceives
vrIpxInReceives.description: This attribute counts the total number of IPX packets received, including those received in error. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInHeaderErrors.name: vrIpxInHeaderErrors
vrIpxInHeaderErrors.description: The number of IPX packets discarded due to errors in their headers, including any IPX packet with a size less than the minimum of 30 bytes. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInUnknownSocket.name: vrIpxInUnknownSocket
vrIpxInUnknownSocket.description: The number of IPX packets discarded because the destination socket was not open. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInDiscards.name: vrIpxInDiscards
vrIpxInDiscards.description: Number of packets received but discarded due to reasons other than those accounted for by inHeaderErrors and inUnknownSocket. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInBadChecksums.name: vrIpxInBadChecksums
vrIpxInBadChecksums.description: Number of packets received with incorrect checksums. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInDelivers.name: vrIpxInDelivers
vrIpxInDelivers.description: Number of IPX packets delivered locally, including packets from local applications. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxNoRoutes.name: vrIpxNoRoutes
vrIpxNoRoutes.description: Number of times no route to a destination was found. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxOutRequests.name: vrIpxOutRequests
vrIpxOutRequests.description: The number of IPX packets supplied locally for transmission, not including any packets counted in the forwarded attribute. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxOutMalformedRequests.name: vrIpxOutMalformedRequests
vrIpxOutMalformedRequests.description: Number of outgoing packets supplied locally that contained errors in their structure. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxOutDiscards.name: vrIpxOutDiscards
vrIpxOutDiscards.description: The number of outgoing IPX packets discarded due to reasons other than those accounted for in outMalformedRequests or outFiltered. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxOutPackets.name: vrIpxOutPackets
vrIpxOutPackets.description: The total number of IPX packets transmitted. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInTooManyHops.name: vrIpxInTooManyHops
vrIpxInTooManyHops.description: Number of packets discarded due to exceeding the maxHops value. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInFiltered.name: vrIpxInFiltered
vrIpxInFiltered.description: The number of incoming IPX packets discarded due to filtering. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxInNetBIOS.name: vrIpxInNetBIOS
vrIpxInNetBIOS.description: The number of NetBIOS packets received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxForwarded.name: vrIpxForwarded
vrIpxForwarded.description: The number of IPX packets forwarded. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxOutFiltered.name: vrIpxOutFiltered
vrIpxOutFiltered.description: The number of outgoing packets discarded due to filtering. This also includes the number of forwarded packets filtered. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxRipRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxRipRowStatusTable
vrIpxRipRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxRip components.

vrIpxRipRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxRipRowStatusEntry
vrIpxRipRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxRip component.

vrIpxRipRowStatus.name: vrIpxRipRowStatus
vrIpxRipRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxRip components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpxRipComponentName.name: vrIpxRipComponentName
vrIpxRipComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxRipStorageType.name: vrIpxRipStorageType
vrIpxRipStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxRip tables.

vrIpxRipIndex.name: vrIpxRipIndex
vrIpxRipIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxRip tables.

vrIpxRipStatsTable.name: vrIpxRipStatsTable
vrIpxRipStatsTable.description: IPX statistics related to the RIP protocol.

vrIpxRipRipIn.name: vrIpxRipRipIn
vrIpxRipRipIn.description: This attribute counts the total number of IPX RIP packets received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxRipRipOut.name: vrIpxRipRipOut
vrIpxRipRipOut.description: This attribute counts the total number of RIP packets locally generated and sent out. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxRipRipIncorrectPackets.name: vrIpxRipRipIncorrectPackets
vrIpxRipRipIncorrectPackets.description: This attribute counts the number of times an incorrectly formatted RIP packet was received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusTable
vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxRipRFltr components.

vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusEntry
vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxRipRFltr component.

vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatus.name: vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatus
vrIpxRipRFltrRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxRipRFltr components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxRipRFltrComponentName.name: vrIpxRipRFltrComponentName
vrIpxRipRFltrComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxRipRFltrStorageType.name: vrIpxRipRFltrStorageType
vrIpxRipRFltrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxRipRFltr tables.

vrIpxRipRFltrIdentifierIndex.name: vrIpxRipRFltrIdentifierIndex
vrIpxRipRFltrIdentifierIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxRipRFltr tables.

vrIpxRipRFltrProvTable.name: vrIpxRipRFltrProvTable
vrIpxRipRFltrProvTable.description: This is the provisionable attribute group for RipFilter.

vrIpxRipRFltrHops.name: vrIpxRipRFltrHops
vrIpxRipRFltrHops.description: This attribute specifies the distance in terms of number of hops. Networks in RIP packets which are the specified distance away from the switch are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. A hops value preceded by an equality operator(=), less than operator(<) or greater than operator(>) should be interpreted as matching all RIP packet tuples which are an equal, smaller or greater distance, respectively, away from the switch than the hops value specified. For a given filter, only networks matching all the specified attributes of that filter are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. The number of hops is specified as a decimal number between 0 and 999.

vrIpxRipRFltrTicks.name: vrIpxRipRFltrTicks
vrIpxRipRFltrTicks.description: This attribute specifies the distance in terms of delay in ticks. A tick is 1/ 18 of a second. Networks in RIP packets which are the specified distance away from the switch are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. A ticks value preceded by a equality operator(=), less than operator(<) or greater than operator(>) should be interpreted as matching all RIP packet tuples which are an equal, greater or lower delay, respectively, away from the switch than the ticks value specified. For a given filter, only networks matching all the specified attributes of that filter are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. The ticks value is specified as a decimal number between 0 and 999.

vrIpxRipRFltrNetworkNumber.name: vrIpxRipRFltrNetworkNumber
vrIpxRipRFltrNetworkNumber.description: This attribute specifies the network number of matching networks in RIP packets to be filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. The network number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits entered in pairs of hex digits up to a maximum length of 8 digits; in addition to hex digits, use of the character '?' to indicate wildcarding is allowed. (For example a valid network number would be ff-ff-ff-?? or ffffff??). Wildcard characters may be used only in pairs to replace a pair of hex digits. Filters with a network number preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as matching all RIP packet tuples except for the tuples with this network number. For a given filter, only networks matching all the specified attributes of that filter are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter.

vrIpxRipRFltrNode.name: vrIpxRipRFltrNode
vrIpxRipRFltrNode.description: This attribute specifies the node portion in the source IPX address (that is, the MAC address or circuit ID) of received RIP packets for which the contained network tuples should be filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. This attribute is only valid for filters applied to a port in the input direction and will be ignored if the filter is applied in the output direction.The node number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits entered in pairs of hex digits up to a maximum length of 12 digits; in addition to hex digits, use of the character '?' to indicate wildcarding is allowed. (For example a valid node number would be 00-20-??-??-??-?? or 0020???????? ). Wildcard characters may be used only in pairs to replace a pair of hex digits. A node number preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as matching all RIP packets' network tuples except for the RIP packets with this source node address. For a given filter, only networks matching all the specified attributes of that filter are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter.

vrIpxRipRFltrPort.name: vrIpxRipRFltrPort
vrIpxRipRFltrPort.description: This attribute specifies the name of a protocol port whereby networks learned over this port are to be filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter. This attribute is only valid for filters applied to a port in the output direction and will be ignored if the filter is applied in the input direction. This attribute is entered as an ascii string and must correspond to a name of a provisioned protocol port. A port name preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as matching all RIP packet tuples except for those learned on this port. For a given filter, only networks matching all the specified attributes of that filter are filtered or passed depending on the disposition of the filter.

vrIpxRipRFltrDisposition.name: vrIpxRipRFltrDisposition
vrIpxRipRFltrDisposition.description: This attribute indicates a reversal of the filter pattern match. If the value is pass, then matching filters will cause the RIP packet tuple to be passed. If the value is filter, then matching filters will cause the RIP packet tuple to be filtered.

vrIpxRipRFltrOperTable.name: vrIpxRipRFltrOperTable
vrIpxRipRFltrOperTable.description: This is the operational attribute group for IpxRipFilter.

vrIpxRipRFltrNumberOfApplyEntries.name: vrIpxRipRFltrNumberOfApplyEntries
vrIpxRipRFltrNumberOfApplyEntries.description: This attribute indicates the number of times this filter is referenced by a RipApplyEntry. If zero, this filter is not applied on any ports.

vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusTable
vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxRipRipApp components.

vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusEntry
vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxRipRipApp component.

vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatus.name: vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatus
vrIpxRipRipAppRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxRipRipApp components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxRipRipAppComponentName.name: vrIpxRipRipAppComponentName
vrIpxRipRipAppComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxRipRipAppStorageType.name: vrIpxRipRipAppStorageType
vrIpxRipRipAppStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxRipRipApp tables.

vrIpxRipRipAppProtocolPortNameIndex.name: vrIpxRipRipAppProtocolPortNameIndex
vrIpxRipRipAppProtocolPortNameIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxRipRipApp tables.

vrIpxRipRipAppFilterIdentifierIndex.name: vrIpxRipRipAppFilterIdentifierIndex
vrIpxRipRipAppFilterIdentifierIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxRipRipApp tables.

vrIpxRipRipAppProvTable.name: vrIpxRipRipAppProvTable
vrIpxRipRipAppProvTable.description: This is the RipApplyEntry provisionable group of attributes.

vrIpxRipRipAppDirection.name: vrIpxRipRipAppDirection
vrIpxRipRipAppDirection.description: This attribute specifies whether this RIP filter is applied as an input filter or an output filter. If set to none, this indicates that the filter, though applied to the port, is not currently active in either direction.

vrIpxSapRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxSapRowStatusTable
vrIpxSapRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxSap components.

vrIpxSapRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxSapRowStatusEntry
vrIpxSapRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxSap component.

vrIpxSapRowStatus.name: vrIpxSapRowStatus
vrIpxSapRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxSap components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpxSapComponentName.name: vrIpxSapComponentName
vrIpxSapComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxSapStorageType.name: vrIpxSapStorageType
vrIpxSapStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxSap tables.

vrIpxSapIndex.name: vrIpxSapIndex
vrIpxSapIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxSap tables.

vrIpxSapStatsTable.name: vrIpxSapStatsTable
vrIpxSapStatsTable.description: IPX statistics specific to the SAP protocol.

vrIpxSapSapIn.name: vrIpxSapSapIn
vrIpxSapSapIn.description: The total number of SAP packets received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxSapSapOut.name: vrIpxSapSapOut
vrIpxSapSapOut.description: The total number of SAP packets locally generated and sent out. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxSapSapIncorrectPackets.name: vrIpxSapSapIncorrectPackets
vrIpxSapSapIncorrectPackets.description: The number of times an incorrectly formatted SAP packet was received. This counter wraps around to zero after reaching the maximum value of 4294967295.

vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusTable
vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxSapSFltr components.

vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusEntry
vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxSapSFltr component.

vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatus.name: vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatus
vrIpxSapSFltrRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxSapSFltr components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxSapSFltrComponentName.name: vrIpxSapSFltrComponentName
vrIpxSapSFltrComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxSapSFltrStorageType.name: vrIpxSapSFltrStorageType
vrIpxSapSFltrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxSapSFltr tables.

vrIpxSapSFltrIdentifierIndex.name: vrIpxSapSFltrIdentifierIndex
vrIpxSapSFltrIdentifierIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxSapSFltr tables.

vrIpxSapSFltrProvTable.name: vrIpxSapSFltrProvTable
vrIpxSapSFltrProvTable.description: The provisionable attribute group for SapFilter.

vrIpxSapSFltrType.name: vrIpxSapSFltrType
vrIpxSapSFltrType.description: This attribute specifies the Novell Service type of the services to be filtered from the SAP packets. The type can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits entered in pairs of hex digits up to a maximum length of 4 digits. (For example a valid type would be ff-ff or ffff). A type preceded by a caret(^) should be interpreted as filtering all SAP packets except for those with this type.

vrIpxSapSFltrName.name: vrIpxSapSFltrName
vrIpxSapSFltrName.description: This attribute specifies the readable name of the service to be filtered from SAP packets. The name can be 47 characters or less. This does not include the caret (^) character which precedes the name. A name preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as filtering all SAP packets except for the ones with this name.

vrIpxSapSFltrNetworkNumber.name: vrIpxSapSFltrNetworkNumber
vrIpxSapSFltrNetworkNumber.description: This attribute specifies the network number of the service to be filtered from SAP packets. The network number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits entered in pairs of hex digits up to a maximum length of 8 digits. (For example a valid network number would be ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffff). A network number preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as filtering all SAP packets except for the ones with this network number.

vrIpxSapSFltrNode.name: vrIpxSapSFltrNode
vrIpxSapSFltrNode.description: This attribute specifies the node portion of the IPX address of the service to be filtered from SAP packets. The node number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits entered in pairs of hex digits up to a maximum length of 12 digits.. (For example a valid node number would be ff-ff-ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffffffff). A node number preceded by a caret (^) should be interpreted as filtering all SAP packets except for the ones with this node number.

vrIpxSapSFltrDisposition.name: vrIpxSapSFltrDisposition
vrIpxSapSFltrDisposition.description: Indicates a reversal of the filter pattern match.

vrIpxSapSFltrOperTable.name: vrIpxSapSFltrOperTable
vrIpxSapSFltrOperTable.description: The operational attribute group for IpxSapFilter.

vrIpxSapSFltrNumberOfApplyEntries.name: vrIpxSapSFltrNumberOfApplyEntries
vrIpxSapSFltrNumberOfApplyEntries.description: The number of times this filter appears in IpxSapApplyEntry. If zero, this filter is not applied on any ports.

vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusTable
vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxSapSapApp components.

vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusEntry
vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxSapSapApp component.

vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatus.name: vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatus
vrIpxSapSapAppRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxSapSapApp components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxSapSapAppComponentName.name: vrIpxSapSapAppComponentName
vrIpxSapSapAppComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxSapSapAppStorageType.name: vrIpxSapSapAppStorageType
vrIpxSapSapAppStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxSapSapApp tables.

vrIpxSapSapAppProtocolPortNameIndex.name: vrIpxSapSapAppProtocolPortNameIndex
vrIpxSapSapAppProtocolPortNameIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSapSapApp tables.

vrIpxSapSapAppFilterIdentifierIndex.name: vrIpxSapSapAppFilterIdentifierIndex
vrIpxSapSapAppFilterIdentifierIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSapSapApp tables.

vrIpxSapSapAppProvTable.name: vrIpxSapSapAppProvTable
vrIpxSapSapAppProvTable.description: The IpxSapApplyEntry provisionable group of attributes.

vrIpxSapSapAppDirection.name: vrIpxSapSapAppDirection
vrIpxSapSapAppDirection.description: Indicates whether this SAP filter is applied as an input filter or an output filter.

vrIpxFwdRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxFwdRowStatusTable
vrIpxFwdRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxFwd components.

vrIpxFwdRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxFwdRowStatusEntry
vrIpxFwdRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxFwd component.

vrIpxFwdRowStatus.name: vrIpxFwdRowStatus
vrIpxFwdRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxFwd components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpxFwdComponentName.name: vrIpxFwdComponentName
vrIpxFwdComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxFwdStorageType.name: vrIpxFwdStorageType
vrIpxFwdStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxFwd tables.

vrIpxFwdNetworkNumberIndex.name: vrIpxFwdNetworkNumberIndex
vrIpxFwdNetworkNumberIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxFwd tables.

vrIpxFwdOperTable.name: vrIpxFwdOperTable
vrIpxFwdOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** IpxForwarding operational attributes.

vrIpxFwdProtocol.name: vrIpxFwdProtocol
vrIpxFwdProtocol.description: The routing protocol from which knowledge of this destination was obtained.

vrIpxFwdTicks.name: vrIpxFwdTicks
vrIpxFwdTicks.description: The delay, in ticks, to reach this destination.

vrIpxFwdHopCount.name: vrIpxFwdHopCount
vrIpxFwdHopCount.description: The number of hops required to reach this destination.

vrIpxFwdProtocolPortId.name: vrIpxFwdProtocolPortId
vrIpxFwdProtocolPortId.description: The unique identifier of the ProtocolPort used to reach the next hop.

vrIpxFwdNextHopPhysAddress.name: vrIpxFwdNextHopPhysAddress
vrIpxFwdNextHopPhysAddress.description: The physical address of the next hop

vrIpxFwdNextHopNetworkNumber.name: vrIpxFwdNextHopNetworkNumber
vrIpxFwdNextHopNetworkNumber.description: The IPX network number of the next hop.

vrIpxSrvcRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxSrvcRowStatusTable
vrIpxSrvcRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxSrvc components.

vrIpxSrvcRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxSrvc component.

vrIpxSrvcRowStatus.name: vrIpxSrvcRowStatus
vrIpxSrvcRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxSrvc components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpxSrvcComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxSrvcStorageType.name: vrIpxSrvcStorageType
vrIpxSrvcStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxSrvc tables.

vrIpxSrvcNetworkNumberIndex.name: vrIpxSrvcNetworkNumberIndex
vrIpxSrvcNetworkNumberIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSrvc tables.

vrIpxSrvcNodeIndex.name: vrIpxSrvcNodeIndex
vrIpxSrvcNodeIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSrvc tables.

vrIpxSrvcTypeIndex.name: vrIpxSrvcTypeIndex
vrIpxSrvcTypeIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSrvc tables.

vrIpxSrvcNameIndex.name: vrIpxSrvcNameIndex
vrIpxSrvcNameIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpxSrvc tables.

vrIpxSrvcOperTable.name: vrIpxSrvcOperTable
vrIpxSrvcOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** The Ipx Services Operational group.

vrIpxSrvcSocket.name: vrIpxSrvcSocket
vrIpxSrvcSocket.description: Socket at which the service is available

vrIpxSrvcProtocol.name: vrIpxSrvcProtocol
vrIpxSrvcProtocol.description: The protocol from which knowledge of this service was obtained.

vrIpxSrvcHopCount.name: vrIpxSrvcHopCount
vrIpxSrvcHopCount.description: Number of hops to the service.

vrIpxAdjRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxAdjRowStatusTable
vrIpxAdjRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxAdj components.

vrIpxAdjRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxAdjRowStatusEntry
vrIpxAdjRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxAdj component.

vrIpxAdjRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxAdj components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpxAdjOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** The Adjacencies operational group.

vrIpxAdjPhysAddress.name: vrIpxAdjPhysAddress
vrIpxAdjPhysAddress.description: The physical address of the adjacent router.

vrIpxAdjAdjacencyState.name: vrIpxAdjAdjacencyState
vrIpxAdjAdjacencyState.description: The state of the connection to the adjacent router.

vrIpxNsRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxNsRowStatusTable
vrIpxNsRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxNs components.

vrIpxNsRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxNsRowStatusEntry
vrIpxNsRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxNs component.

vrIpxNsRowStatus.name: vrIpxNsRowStatus
vrIpxNsRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxNs components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxNsComponentName.name: vrIpxNsComponentName
vrIpxNsComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxNsStorageType.name: vrIpxNsStorageType
vrIpxNsStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxNs tables.

vrIpxNsIndex.name: vrIpxNsIndex
vrIpxNsIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxNs tables.

vrIpxNsProvTable.name: vrIpxNsProvTable
vrIpxNsProvTable.description: The provisionable attribute group for the IpxNetSentry component.

vrIpxNsFirstFilter.name: vrIpxNsFirstFilter
vrIpxNsFirstFilter.description: First NetSentry filter for Ipx. If specified this filter is applied before any other NetSentry filters applicable to the packet.

vrIpxNsLastFilter.name: vrIpxNsLastFilter
vrIpxNsLastFilter.description: Last filter for Ipx. If specified this filter is applied after all other NetSentry filters applicable to the packet.

vrIpxNsLocalInFilter.name: vrIpxNsLocalInFilter
vrIpxNsLocalInFilter.description: The filter name of the NetSentry filter to be applied at the Local In filter point.

vrIpxNsLocalOutFilter.name: vrIpxNsLocalOutFilter
vrIpxNsLocalOutFilter.description: The filter name of the NetSentry filter to be applied at the Local Out filter point.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusTable.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusTable
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpxNsNetSentryApp components.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusEntry
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpxNsNetSentryApp component.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatus.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatus
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpxNsNetSentryApp components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppComponentName.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppComponentName
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppStorageType.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppStorageType
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpxNsNetSentryApp tables.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppEntryIndex.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppEntryIndex
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppEntryIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpxNsNetSentryApp tables.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppProvTable.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppProvTable
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppProvTable.description: The Provisionable group for the IpxNetSentryApplyList.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppFilter.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppFilter
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppFilter.description: The name of the filter to be applied to packets matching the conditions in this entry of the IpxNetSentryApplyList.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber1.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber1
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber1.description: The first IPX network Number used to compare. This network number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits. (For example a valid network number would be ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffff). In addition a value of * will be accepted as a wildcard for all networks.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode1.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode1
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode1.description: This attribute is the first IPX node address used to compare. This node number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits. (For example a valid node number would be ff-ff-ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffffffff). In addition a value of * will be accepted as a wildcard for all nodes.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppDirection.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppDirection
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppDirection.description: Indicates the direction a packet must be moving between the first and second apply list entries in order for the entries to match. First 'to' second, first 'from' second, or first 'tofrom' second (either direction).

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber2.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber2
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNetworkNumber2.description: The second IPX network Number used to compare. This network number can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits. (For example a valid network number would be ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffff). In addition a value of * will be accepted as a wildcard for all networks.

vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode2.name: vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode2
vrIpxNsNetSentryAppNode2.description: This attribute is the second IPX node address used to compared. This node can be entered either as a dashed hex string or a string of hex digits. (For example a valid network number would be ff-ff-ff-ff-ff-ff or ffffffffffff). In addition a value of * will be accepted as a wildcard for all nodes.
